In which Taehyung eats a magical fortune cookie and wakes up physically dependent on Jeongguk’s body heat.

text:
As a rule, Taehyung has never been particularly good at following directions. He doesn’t do it on purpose - he just gets distracted, or forgets, or gets curious about what would happen if he takes a different approach. This has resulted in some funny outcomes, for example when he tried to give Yeontan a bath and accidentally turned him pink for a few days, and some less funny outcomes, ie when he tried to install a giant lava lamp in his room and ended up shorting the power to half the dorm. Luckily, none of these misadventures have had particularly serious consequences - that is, until The Saga that begins at the 2018 Golden Disc Awards.

In retrospect, Taehyung acknowledges that the lady at the concession table probably did tell them that the purple fortune cookie was FOR SHOW ONLY, DO NOT EAT. At the time, though, taking this cookie seems like the obvious choice, mostly because it’s purple, duh, and how often does one see a purple fortune cookie? For the record, it tastes really good, too, which is why he shovels the whole thing into his mouth before he even spares a glance at the fortune itself.

It’s longer than a usual fortune, written in scrawling purple font across a folded piece of white paper. It’s also less generic than the fortunes Taehyung is accustomed to seeing, with messages about changes on the horizon or finding success in life. The paper reads:

Where there is love, there is warmth.
Where there is honesty, there is relief.

Not one he’s seen before, but he doesn’t think much of it, going to toss the slip into the trash.

“Wait!” A stern voice makes him freeze, and he looks up to see the concession table lady. “Did you eat the purple cookie?” she asks sharply. Her tone seems a little serious for a question about a fortune cookie, but maybe she’s having a bad day.

“Umm... yes?” Taehyung says.

The woman shakes her head, muttering something to herself about privileged boy band members. “You’re going to want to save that,” she says, nodding at the fortune.

Taehyung looks down at the crumpled piece of paper in his hand, confused. “...why? Is it like, a special fortune?”

“You could say that,” the woman replies. “Good luck.” And then she bustles off surprisingly quickly for a woman of her age.

Taehyung blinks, not sure what to make of this encounter. Then he shrugs, slips the fortune into his back pocket, and gets distracted by Hoseok and Namjoon waving him over for a selfie.

They win the Daesang, which is incredible and mind blowing and emotional, as it has been every time. As Taehyung stands in a shell-shocked huddle with the other members, their arms wrapped around each other, all he can think is how grateful he is, for their success but especially for these people. They’ve been through so much together, and he can’t imagine doing it without these 6 boys by his side.

They go home that night, as they’ll need to be up early for a full day of last minute promo and rehearsals for the 4th Muster tomorrow. As is often the case, Taehyung follows Jeongguk into whatever car he’s shepherded into, and they curl up in the backseat, Taehyung dropping his head onto Jeongguk’s shoulder.

“Do you think that feeling of winning will ever get old?” he asks sleepily.

“I dunno,” Jeongguk replies through a yawn. “I hope not, I never want to take it for granted.”

“Mm,” Taehyung hums in agreement, snuggling closer into Jeongguk’s side. “You’re so nice and warm.”

Jeongguk doesn’t say anything in response, just absentmindedly runs his fingers through Taehyung’s hair as they drive through the darkness.

***

Taehyung wakes up the next morning shivering so violently that he at first thinks he’s somehow ended up outside. When he looks around and establishes that he is in fact in his room, in his bed, he stumbles over to the thermostat, wondering if the heat had cut out overnight. It reads 22 degrees Celsius, a perfectly normal indoor temperature, but he twists the dial up anyway before diving back into his bed and burrowing as far as he can under the blankets. None of this seems to help, and he’s starting to get concerned that he’s going to bite his own tongue off with how hard his teeth are chattering.

He sticks a hand out from under the covers, feeling around for his phone until he locates it on his bedside table. With shaking fingers, he types out a message to the boys:

>sos am maybe dying pls come to my room<

No one responds immediately, but there’s a soft knock on his door a few minutes later, and Jimin appears, his hair still sticking up from sleep.

“What’s the matter, drama qu- “ he begins, but then his focus actually settles on Taehyung, and he cuts himself off. “Shit, are you okay? You’re shaking like a leaf.”

“I’m f-freezing,” Taehyung stutters out. His fingers feel numb, even where he has them tucked under his armpits. “I don’t know what’s wrong with me, I just woke up feeling like this.”

“Seriously?” Jimin says, concerned. “It’s like, a million degrees in here.” He crosses the room to Taehyung’s bed, pressing a hand to his forehead. His touch feels lukewarm, an improvement from Taehyung’s current state but not by much. “Jesus Christ, your skin is ice cold.” He looks genuinely worried now.

“Told you,” Taehyung says weakly.

“I’m going to get Seokjin hyung, hang on,” Jimin tells him, hurrying out of the room. He reappears with Seokjin in tow a few minutes later. Seokjin takes one look at Taehyung and his mouth droops into a frown to match Jimin’s.

“Shit, you weren’t kidding,” he says once he’s had a chance to feel Taehyung’s skin for himself. “I think we should ask management about calling a doctor, this is intense.”

“Shouldn’t we at least try to warm him up first?” Jimin asks, lifting up the covers and sliding into bed next to Taehyung. He wraps his arms around his torso, hugging him close. “Does this help at all?”

“Maybe a li-little,” Taehyung says. He’s starting to get freaked out himself - why is nothing helping?

“His lips are literally blue, I’m getting management,” Seokjin declares, just as the door to Taehyung’s room opens and a sleep-rumpled Jeongguk appears.

“What’s going on?” he asks, looking between the three of them, his gaze snagging briefly on Jimin essentially spooning Taehyung in his bed.

“Taehyungie is sick,” Jimin says. “His skin is freezing and he can’t get warm.”

Jeongguk’s eyebrows shoot up in concern, and he walks over to the bed, pressing a tentative hand to Taehyung’s cheek.

The reaction is instantaneous. Warmth, glorious warmth, shoots through Taehyung’s body as if emanating from the place where Jeongguk had touched him. Taehyung flinches hard in surprise, gasping, and Jeongguk pulls back sharply, looking embarrassed.

“Sorry, I’m sorry,” he says hurriedly, backing away like a kicked puppy.

“No,” Taehyung says, shaking his head and reaching out for him. “No, wait, do that again, please.”

They all stare at him, but Jeongguk complies, inching forward until his knuckles brush against Taehyung’s cheek again. Taehyung sighs in relief, the same warmth seeping through his body.

“You’re so warm,” he explains. Jeongguk looks down at him with wide, searching eyes, but he doesn’t move his hand.

“Like, warmer than Jimin?” Seokjin asks, pressing a hand to both Jeongguk and Jimin. “They feel the same to me.”

“I dunno,” Taehyung says. “Jeonggukie feels warmer. Like, really warm.”

“Jeongguk, switch places with Jimin,” Seokjin instructs, his forehead knit with confusion.

Jeongguk’s eyes get even wider. “I - ” he stammers, but Seokjin shushes him.

“Quickly, it seems like the only thing that will help right now.”

Jeongguk shuts his mouth and nods, slipping under the covers as Jimin scrambles out to make room for him.

“Oh my god,” Taehyung whimpers, burrowing against him immediately. Jeongguk feels like a giant heater, a welcome respite to the brutal cold wracking his body.

“Is that better?” Jeongguk asks, eyes soft with concern.

“So much better, thank you,” Taehyung replies. Jeongguk wraps his arms around him, hooking his chin over Taehyung’s shoulder, and Taehyung sighs contentedly.

Seokjin and Jimin are both staring at them now, completely bemused.

“You’re not shaking anymore,” Jimin points out.

“This is bizarre,” Seokjin says. “Let’s get the other boys and see if they’re feeling okay.”

And so Namjoon, Yoongi, and Hoseok are summoned, filtering into the room in various states of alertness given that it’s hardly 7am. They all feel fine, but none of them have the same effect on Taehyung as Jeongguk - they all feel lukewarm, like Jimin had.

“I still feel like we should call a doctor,” Seokjin says, and Namjoon nods in agreement. “I’m glad Jeongguk is helping, but this is definitely not normal.”

“They’re going to think I’m on some sort of weird drug trip,” Taehyung protests.

“Are you on some sort of weird drug trip?!” Jimin asks, alarmed.

“No!” Taehyung replies, indignant. “You know I would never, come on.”

“Maybe we should give it a day,” Namjoon says practically. “It could just be a weird bug, or something, and maybe Jeongguk just gives off extra body heat. Taehyung seems okay now.”

This is true - with Jeongguk wrapped snugly around him, Taehyung feels mostly fine. Still a little chillier than usual, maybe, but nothing unbearable.

“I can stay with you for the day, just in case,” Jeongguk offers, and Taehyung squeezes his hand in thanks.

“Okay...” Seokjin says reluctantly. “But if gets bad again, I’m telling management.”

“Deal.”

The rest of the boys disperse to get ready for the day’s activities - they have to do some last minute promo shots for the Muster, and then they have choreography rehearsals all afternoon. The photo shoot won’t start until later in the morning, so Taehyung and Jeongguk are left alone for a few hours to explore the nuances of their new... situation.

They discover that, if Jeongguk touches him for long enough, the residual warmth seems to stay with Taehyung, and he can be okay on his own for a little while. It also becomes apparent that the more of their bodies that are touching, the more it helps, and bare skin seems to be especially effective (although they skirt neatly right around the implications of that).

This last discovery comes when they’ve ventured to Jeongguk’s room and broken apart temporarily so that he can get dressed. Taehyung starts shivering again while Jeongguk is standing in front of his closet, still shirtless as he ponders aloud about what to wear.

“Should I wear my red sweatshirt or the graphic one?” he asks. “Or wait, there’s the gray one from Topman - oh, fuck, you’re shaking.”

“Sorry,” Taehyung says as Jeongguk hurries over and wraps his arms around him.

Jeongguk has worked a lot on getting stronger in the past year, and the change in his body is not lost on Taehyung, no matter how much he tries not to focus on it (he fears his head might explode if he does). He’s always been toned, but he has muscles now, sculpted arms and a set of abs that Taehyung tells himself would make any normal human take a second look. It would be more distracting to have said muscled arms and chest pressed against him right now were it not for the huge rush of heat that hits him as soon as they touch.

“Oh my god, you’re even warmer without a shirt on,” Taehyung hums appreciatively, burrowing into him.

Jeongguk coughs. “Oh, really? I guess that makes sense.”

“Mm. I like the red sweatshirt.”

Jeongguk tows him over to the closet, keeping one arm around his waist and only removing it when he pulls a T-shirt and the sweatshirt over his head. Taehyung tries not to whine audibly at the loss of his direct body heat. On the bright side, at least now he has a valid, not creepy excuse for wanting Jeongguk to be shirtless all the time.

“This is really weird,” Jeongguk observes, hopping around on one foot to get his shoes on since one of his hands is linked with Taehyung’s. “Do you think I’m like, supernaturally warm or something?” He pauses, his face lighting up with excitement. “Maybe I’m a werewolf!”

“Does that make me a vampire?” Taehyung asks, making a face. “I’m not craving blood. Although I could go for some lunch soon, are they ordering food for the photo shoot?”

Jeongguk shrugs, assessing himself in the mirror. When did his jaw line get so defined, Taehyung wonders? It seems like just a few minutes ago he was just a baby faced teenager - when did he become this man who Taehyung is, regrettably, finding himself more and more attracted to?

He and Jeongguk have been close pretty much since the beginning, although it had taken a little while for Taehyung to wear through his shyness and general aversion to being touched at first. But soon enough it became clear that they actually had a lot in common, and a special bond developed between them. Taehyung feels extremely close to all six members - they’re a family by now - but it’s no secret that Jeongguk is his number one, and vice versa. It’s never amounted to anything more than a very deep friendship though, and Taehyung has accepted that, even though he would be lying if he said the thought had never crossed his mind. They’ve had their close calls, moments when it felt like things were tipping into uncharted territory, but nothing ever came of it. It’s better this way, Taehyung has convinced himself - easier, neater. He just wishes Jeongguk would stop getting hotter (no pun intended) seemingly with each passing second, because even though his mind is practical, his body certainly is not.

The promo shots are being done in-house, so Jeongguk gives him a piggy back to the studio where they’ve been told to meet. It ends up not mattering which sweatshirt Jeongguk picked, because the stylists adjust their outfits anyway, switching out certain items and fussing with their hair. It’s a testament to how touchy Taehyung is to begin with that no one bats an eye at him following Jeongguk around all day, clinging to him at every chance he gets. He can feel the boys watching him more closely than usual, especially Seokjin and Jimin, but they seem somewhat appeased once they see Taehyung acting like his usual self.

The choreography rehearsals go smoothly as well, and the exercise seems to help a little, which is reassuring. Taehyung sticks close to Jeongguk just in case, linking their arms together or latching on to him from behind whenever he starts to feel cold again. He feels sort of like an addict, taking hits of Jeongguk to keep himself feeling normal, but it works like a charm every time. All he knows is that he’s grateful that Jeongguk’s super human body heat seems to be the antidote to this weird reverse fever situation he has going on, because he would probably be freaking out a lot harder if he wasn’t.

The 7 of them eat dinner together, Jeongguk’s thigh pressed up against Taehyung’s under the table, and then retreat to their various rooms for an early bedtime, knowing that tomorrow will be hectic and exhausting with the first night of the Muster.

“So, umm,” Jeongguk says awkwardly when they get to Taehyung’s door. “I guess... we should probably sleep together?”

Taehyung quirks an eyebrow at him. “Jeonggukie, so forward!” he teases.

“Shut up,” Jeongguk groans, turning red. “You know what I mean, like share a bed.”

“Probably,” Taehyung nods. “Would be bad if I turned into an icicle the night before the Muster.”

“Very,” Jeongguk agrees. “Alright, I’m just gonna go change, I’ll be back in a minute.”

Taehyung slips into his own pajamas while he waits, wondering why he suddenly feels so nervous. He and Jeongguk have shared a bed plenty of times before, especially when they were younger and less famous and the hotels they stayed in weren’t as nice. There’s just something weird about making the conscious decision to do so, and the fact that they’re definitely going to have to cuddle if Taehyung is going to make it through the night.

Jeongguk returns not long after, dressed in black sweats and a white T-shirt, and effectively cuts off Taehyung’s unexpected nerve spiral. They climb into Taehyung’s bed (as they’ve done many times before, he reminds himself), and Jeongguk hugs him close.

“Thanks for being such a good sport about this,” Taehyung murmurs against his chest. “I know it seems really crazy.”

“No worries,” Jeongguk replies. “I just am glad I can help.”

“Me too,” Taehyung yawns. “Hopefully this was just some weird fluke and everything is back to normal tomorrow.”

“Yeah, hopefully,” Jeongguk echoes. Something in his voice sounds a little off, but Taehyung falls asleep before he can put his finger on what.

***

Jeongguk wakes up in the middle of the night to find that he and Taehyung have rolled apart. Taehyung still seems to be asleep, but he’s shivering, and when Jeongguk reaches over to touch him, his skin is disconcertingly cold. Alarmed, he tugs off his own shirt and pulls Taehyung back to him, remembering what Taehyung had said about him being extra warm when he was shirtless. Not that Jeongguk has been reading too much into that, or anything.

So this explains why, when he wakes up again the next morning, Taehyung blinks at him curiously and says: “When did you get naked?”

“I’m not naked,” Jeongguk squawks, panicking for a second until he confirms that he is in fact still wearing his sweatpants.

“Ok, fine, shirtless,” Taehyung replies, rolling his eyes.

“I woke up in the middle of the night and you were freezing,” Jeongguk explains, rubbing the sleep out of his eyes and yawning. He could get used to waking up next to Taehyung. “So I thought the extra body heat would help.”

“Oh,” Taehyung says, his eyes soft. “Thanks.”

Jeongguk shrugs, swallowing. All of this extra proximity to Taehyung is making it even more difficult than usual for him to act normal (read: like he doesn’t have a hopeless crush on his best friend). “How are you feeling this morning?”

“I feel fine now,” Taehyung says. “But I haven’t really been apart from you, so I can’t say for sure.”

Jeongguk pointedly ignores the familiar fluttering in his stomach, stretching his arms over his head. “I’ll go get dressed, then. Come over if you start getting cold.”

Privately, he’s kind of glad when there’s a knock at his door thirty minutes later, and he opens it to find Taehyung standing in the hallway, hugging himself. This definitely makes him a horrible person, 100%, but selfishly he likes having an excuse to touch Taehyung all the time.

“Not better, then?” he says, opening his arms. Taehyung huddles against him immediately. He doesn’t feel as cold as he had last night, but the chill still seeps through the fabric of Jeongguk’s shirt.

“Guess not.”

They break the news to the other boys at breakfast, and predictably they immediately say it’s time to call a doctor. Jeongguk thinks they have a point, considering this is highly worrisome and definitely not normal, even if selfishly he’s not in a huge rush to get it figured out.

Taehyung waves them off. “Guys, I’m fine. There’s no time for me to see a doctor anyway, the Muster starts tonight!”

“You are definitely not fine if you start turning into an ice cube every time you’re away from Jeongguk for too long!” Seokjin argues.

“So I’ll stay close to him,” Taehyung retorts, looping his arm through Jeongguk’s.

“Forever?” Jimin says dubiously, and Jeongguk’s stomach does a backflip.

“Come on, let’s just get through the Muster, okay?” Taehyung pleads. “Then we can figure it out.”

Seokjin opens his mouth, but Namjoon pats him on the shoulder reassuringly. “We’re going to be together the whole time. As long as Jeongguk-ah is there, he’ll be okay.” They all turn to look at Jeongguk.

“Yeah, of course, I’ll be right there,” he says firmly, without hesitation, and Taehyung flashes him a grateful smile.

The thing is, Jeongguk will always be there if Taehyung needs him, even if it hurts, even if it means setting his own feelings aside sometimes. Taehyung is a rare kind of friend, someone who really sees him for who he is and who has been by his side through so much - good and bad. There is a part of Jeongguk that wants and has always wanted more, but he’d decided a long time ago that their friendship was the most important, that as long as he could keep Taehyung in his life, that would be enough. It’s not enough, not really, but he’ll take what he can get - Taehyung is worth it.

The day passes in a blur of last minute fittings, hair and makeup, and dress rehearsals. They’re debuting some new choreography tonight, which Jeongguk is excited about - the fans are going to go wild, and it’s always nice to add some variety to their performances. Taehyung hovers close to him while they’re getting ready, so much so that the makeup noonas admonish him because he keeps making Jeongguk laugh. In the end, he settles on the floor in front of Jeongguk’s chair, sitting with his back against Jeongguk’s legs while he fiddles with his phone.

The first night of the Muster is just as much of a success as they had hoped. The ARMYs are as happy and responsive as ever, eating up the skits and the new choreo. They also are used to the seven of them being touchy onstage, so it’s relatively easy to find opportunities to grab ahold of Taehyung and make sure he’s sufficiently warm. They’re all skilled enough at being in front of a crowd by now to pass it off as just a regular part of the show, even if Jeongguk’s touches linger a little longer than they usually would. For strictly scientific reasons, of course.

He and Taehyung share a car back to the dorms with Hoseok, who shoots an appraising look at where they’re cuddled together in the backseat and says: “Aren’t you two cute.”

Jeongguk fights to keep his expression neutral, but Taehyung beams, squeezing him tighter. “My personal space heater.”

Back at the dorms, they all disperse, congratulating each other on a good show as they traipse off to their respective rooms. Taehyung turns to Jeongguk, yawning, and says casually: “Wanna sleep in your bed tonight?”

Something about the way he says it knocks the wind out of Jeongguk - so easy, so natural, as if they’re a couple that actually does share a bed every night. Not just two friends, one of whom happens to have a body temperature regulation issue that can apparently only be moderated by the other.

“Oh,” Jeongguk says, trying not to stutter. “Yeah, sure.”

“Yay, I like that fuzzy blanket you have.”

“You mean the one that you always steal and is currently in your bedroom?”

Taehyung blinks at him. “Right, so I’ll bring that over once I’m done getting changed.”

Jeongguk chuckles, shaking his head as he heads to his own room to change into pajamas. He debates foregoing a shirt, especially considering what had happened last night, but ends up chickening out and pulling a T-shirt on at the last second. It feels a little too close to actually dating territory to start the night without a shirt on, even if there is a legitimate reason for it.

“Decided to keep your clothes on tonight, I see,” Taehyung teases, waltzing into Jeongguk’s room without knocking. You’d think he would have learned not to do that by now, after all the times they’ve accidentally caught each other in compromising positions, but Taehyung has never been great with boundaries.

“Disappointed?” Jeongguk fires back cheekily, trying not to blush. He wishes.

Taehyung raises his eyebrows in surprise, always delighted when Jeongguk sasses him back. “Maybe,” he tosses back with a cheeky wink, and Jeongguk has to disguise the choking sound he makes as a cough. Taehyung looks at him curiously.

“For the record, I took my shirt off last night to keep you from freezing to death, you ungrateful ass,” Jeongguk says when he stops coughing.

“I know,” Taehyung concedes, shuffling over and hugging him. He has Jeongguk’s blanket draped around his shoulders like a cape. “You’re the best friend ever, I don’t deserve you.”

Jeongguk grumbles but hugs him back anyway - he’s powerless, really, when it comes to Taehyung.

“How’d you think tonight went?” Taehyung asks, releasing Jeongguk in favor of crawling into his bed.

“Well, I think,” Jeongguk says, following him. “It was fun to get to perform Best of Me.”

“Yeah, I like that choreography.” He snuggles up close to Jeongguk, pressing his toes against his calf.

“Jesus, your toes are freezing,” Jeongguk yelps, jerking away.

“Yeah well, whose fault is that?”

Jeongguk glowers at him incredulously. “What happened to ‘oh Jeongguk, I don’t deserve you?’ You’re all talk.”

“Sorry, sorry,” Taehyung says, properly chastised. He tips his forehead forward until it rests on Jeongguk’s shoulder. “I meant it though, I really don’t deserve you.”

His voice is soft, and Jeongguk’s heart stutters in his chest. He doesn’t know what to say in response, but luckily Taehyung saves him from having to think of something. Always rescuing him from feeling awkward.

“Seriously though, will you warm up my toes?”

“Ugh, fine,” Jeongguk groans, flinching when he feels Taehyung’s icy feet against his calf again. He doesn’t mind, though, not really - not if it means he gets to fall asleep to the sound of Taehyung breathing gently beside him.

***

On the third morning of The Saga, Taehyung wakes up at a pleasant temperature, tucked into the side of a sleeping Jeongguk. He’s mildly disappointed to find that Jeongguk is still wearing a shirt this morning, but he dismisses that thought quickly, internally scolding himself for being such a creeper.

Never one to last very long without some form of attention, he fidgets and shifts at Jeongguk’s side, hoping the movement will “accidentally” wake him up. When this is unsuccessful (not surprising, considering Jeongguk sleeps like the dead and usually requires a minimum of 30 minutes to turn into a functional, responsive human being), Taehyung resorts to more direct tactics, such as repeatedly prodding his nose.

“Mmf,” Jeongguk grunts eventually, stirring. “Wha.”

“Good morning, sunshine,” Taehyung greets cheerily, squishing his cheeks.

Jeongguk cracks one eye open, looking startled for a moment when he sees Taehyung next to him in bed. Then the pieces seem to fall into place, and he says: “I see you didn’t turn into an ice cube overnight.”

“Huzzah,” Taehyung replies, pressing his hands together as if in prayer. “All thanks to you, Jeonggukie.”

“Mm.”

“I’m hungry,” Taehyung announces as Jeongguk’s eyes drift shut again. “Do you think there’s cake?”

“It’s 8am,” Jeongguk says without opening his eyes.

“So?”

Jeongguk sighs.

“I’m going to investigate, I’ll bring some back if I find it.”

He crawls out of bed, merrily ignoring Jeongguk’s mumbled response of “diet,” and sets off for the kitchen. Once there, he finds Jimin, still in his pajamas, staring blankly at the contents of the refrigerator.

“Morning, Jiminie,” Taehyung says, and Jimin nods at him. “Whatcha doin?”

“Trying to decide what I want for breakfast,” he replies sleepily. His expression shifts to alarm. “Wait a minute, where’s Jeongguk? Are you okay?”

“I’m fine, I just left him in bed,” Taehyung explains, waving him off, even though he does feel a bit cooler than he had a few minutes ago. “I came in search of cake.”

Jimin blinks at him but doesn’t question this, which Taehyung views as a testament to how well they’ve gotten to know each other over the years.

“Oh! Look, there is some left over,” Taehyung cries happily, lightly hip checking Jimin to the side and reaching into the refrigerator. There had been a small birthday celebration for one of their crew members in the dorm the other day, and the remnants of the cake had ended up in their kitchen. “Want some?” he asks, turning to Jimin.

Jimin wrinkles his nose. “I’m just going to have some fruit... since it’s the morning...”

“Suit yourself,” Taehyung shrugs, grabbing two forks out of the drawer. “See you in a bit.”

Not surprisingly, Jeongguk still hasn’t moved by the time Taehyung makes it back to his room. The only natural response, obviously, is for Taehyung to climb on top of him and sit cross legged across his thighs.

“Ugh, get off,” Jeongguk groans, batting at him weakly.

Taehyung bounces slightly instead. “I have cake!”

“I don’t care,” Jeongguk replies, opening his eyes so that he can glare at Taehyung.

Taehyung spears a bite of cake on a fork and shoves it in Jeongguk’s face, grinning.

“I told you, I’m on a d - ” he cuts off when Taehyung stuffs the cake into his open mouth. “I literally hate you,” he says once he finishes swallowing.

“It’s good though, right?”

Instead of responding, Jeongguk jerks his legs up, sending Taehyung sprawling to the side. Luckily, he manages to save the cake from toppling on to Jeongguk’s bed.

“Rude,” Taehyung pouts. “Now I’m not going to share with you anymore.”

Jeongguk lunges at him, his mouth closing around the bite of cake that Taehyung now has on his fork. Taehyung squeals indignantly, wriggling away, but somehow they end up face to face, Jeongguk hovering over him with one hand on either side of his head.
